resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
BryanCutler commented on pull request #4105: ARROW-5062: [Java] Shade com.google.guava usage in Flight
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4105
 
 
   This adds com.google.guava usage in Arrow Flight to the shaded artifact. Guava is a commonly used library and could cause a conflict if a user has an older, incompatible version of Guava as a dependency.

BryanCutler commented on issue #4105: ARROW-5062: [Java] Shade com.google.guava usage in Flight
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4105#issuecomment-479671099
 
 
   @jacques-n , I was a little unsure if your comment from the JIRA meant to add an additional shaded artifact to the build, so I just added to the the existing one here. Happy to change it up if you want. If you were concerned about the size of the shaded jar, it went from ~2.5 MB to ~5 MB after this change.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: The Guava dependency in the Java Flight module can interfere if using Flight in an application that relies on an older version of Guava.  We can shade the usage in Flight to prevent this.
fields.summary: [Java] Shade Java Guava dependency for Flight

comments.body:
I ran into an issue when trying Flight with Apache Spark, which uses an old version of Guava.  Spark can be built with Guava shaded using mvn but not sbt, so it's not a blocker but still kind of a pain.

[~jacques@dremio.com] does this sound ok with you?
Let's just add a second artifact with guava shaded as well (rather than replace the existing one). Would prefer to avoid doubling loading/storing where we don't need to with a large artifact.

[~jnadeau] so there is already a shaded jar that shades protocol buffers, do you mean add another shaded jar?

flight/target/arrow-flight-0.13.0-SNAPSHOT-shaded.jar
flight/target/arrow-flight-0.13.0-SNAPSHOT-jar-with-dependencies.jar
flight/target/arrow-flight-0.13.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
Hey [~bryanc], we should have as second shaded version as opposed to adding guava to existing one.
